opendial.gui

Class StateViewerTab

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • opendial.gui.StateViewerTab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class StateViewerTab
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    GUI component used to view and control the Bayesian Network representing the dialogue state.

    The component includes functionalities for:

    • rendering a full graphical version of the network, including all types of nodes and their respective dependencies;
    • zooming and translating the network in various directions;
    • providing details about the random variables and their distribution;
    • performing runtime inference over selected sets of random variables;
    • navigating through different recorded versions of the network.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-03-06 10:49:41 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • showParameters

        public void showParameters(boolean showParameters)
        Sets whether to show the parameter variables in the state viewer or not.
        Parameters:
        showParameters - whether to show or hide the parameters

      • showParameters

        public boolean showParameters()
        Returns true if the parameter variables are currently displayed in the state viewer. Returns false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if parameters are shown, false otherwise.

      • trigger

        public void trigger(DialogueState state,
           java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> updatedVars)
        Updates the current dialogue state displayed in the component. The current dialogue state is named "Current state" in the selection list.
        Parameters:
        state - the updated Bayesian Network

      • recordState

        public void recordState(DialogueState state,
               java.lang.String name)
        Records a dialogue state in the component and makes it available for display in the network selection list on the left side. The network is associated with a specific name. If the name already exists, the previous network is erased.
        Parameters:
        state - the dialogue state to record
        name - the name for the recorded network

      • writeToLogArea

        public void writeToLogArea(java.lang.String text)
        Writes the given text in the logging area at the bottom of the window
        Parameters:
        text - the text to write (can be HTML code)
